scams.name: Fake Police
scams.description: Fake police officers ask to see your passport and wallet to 'check for counterfeit money' then steal cash
scams.prevention: Real police will show proper ID. Ask to go to the police station if questioned

scams.name: Friendship Bracelet
scams.description: Someone approaches you to tie a 'friendship bracelet' on your wrist, then demands payment
scams.prevention: Keep your hands in your pockets and walk away quickly

scams.name: Petition Signing
scams.description: People ask you to sign a petition while accomplices pickpocket you
scams.prevention: Never sign anything from strangers on the street

scams.name: ATM Helper
scams.description: Someone offers to help you use an ATM, then steals your card details or cash
scams.prevention: Only use ATMs inside banks or hotels. Never accept help from strangers

scams.name: Fake Taxi
scams.description: Unlicensed taxis charge extremely high rates or take you to wrong destinations
scams.prevention: Use official taxi apps or pre-arranged transportation. Check meter is running

scams.name: Overpriced SIM Cards
scams.description: Airport vendors sell SIM cards at 5-10x normal price to tourists
scams.prevention: Buy SIM cards from official telecom stores in the city, not at airports

scams.name: Slow Count
scams.description: Cashiers count change very slowly hoping you'll leave without all your money
scams.prevention: Always count your change before leaving. Don't be rushed

scams.name: Fake Train Tickets
scams.description: People sell fake or expired train tickets near stations
scams.prevention: Only buy tickets from official ticket offices or machines

scams.name: Distraction Theft
scams.description: Someone spills something on you or creates a distraction while accomplices steal your belongings
scams.prevention: Be aware of your surroundings. If someone approaches unexpectedly, protect your valuables

scams.name: Gem Scam
scams.description: Sellers claim you can buy gems cheaply and resell them for profit in your home country
scams.prevention: Never buy expensive items from street vendors or unlicensed shops

scams.name: Carpet Scam
scams.description: Sellers use high-pressure tactics and fake backstories to sell overpriced carpets
scams.prevention: Research prices beforehand. Never feel pressured to buy immediately

scams.name: Tea/Coffee Invitation
scams.description: Friendly locals invite you for tea, then present you with an enormous bill
scams.prevention: Be cautious of unsolicited invitations. Always ask about prices upfront

scams.name: Wrong Change
scams.description: Vendors give incorrect change, hoping tourists won't notice or are too polite to complain
scams.prevention: Always count your change immediately. Know the local currency denominations

scams.name: Fake WiFi Networks
scams.description: Criminals set up fake WiFi hotspots to steal personal information and passwords
scams.prevention: Only use official hotel/restaurant WiFi. Avoid networks with generic names

scams.name: Overcharging Tourists
scams.description: Restaurants and shops charge tourists higher prices than locals
scams.prevention: Check prices beforehand. Ask for menus with prices. Learn basic local numbers

scams.name: Fake Travel Insurance
scams.description: Scammers sell fake travel insurance policies that provide no coverage
scams.prevention: Only buy insurance from reputable companies. Verify coverage details

scams.name: Pickpocketing
scams.description: Thieves steal from pockets, bags, or purses in crowded areas
scams.prevention: Keep valuables in front pockets or money belts. Stay alert in crowds

scams.name: Fake Tickets
scams.description: Scammers sell fake tickets to popular attractions, shows, or events
scams.prevention: Buy tickets only from official sources or authorized vendors

scams.name: Fake Charity
scams.description: People approach tourists asking for donations to fake charities
scams.prevention: Research charities before donating. Don't give money to street solicitors

scams.name: Rental Car Damage
scams.description: Car rental companies charge for pre-existing damage they claim you caused
scams.prevention: Document all damage before driving. Take photos from all angles
